subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 11 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Galaxy snub Real over Beckham bid
Real Madrid have a bid to buy David Beckham out of his LA Galaxy contract rejected by the MLS club.



 
Takeover bid made for Birmingham
Birmingham confirm they have been approached about a possible takeover bid.



 
Man City call for Thaksin answers
Manchester City ask for an explanation from potential investor Thaksin Shinawatra over reports his bank accounts have been frozen.








GOLF




Howell misses US Open with injury
David Howell pulls out of this week's US Open with a wrist injury.



 
Ballesteros will not play in Open
Seve Ballesteros opts not to enter for next month's Open championship at Carnoustie.



 
New Indian event sparks Tour row
The announcement of a new European Tour event in India prompts an angry response from the Asian Tour.








MOTORSPORT




Walker tips Hamilton for F1 title
Former commentator Murray Walker believes Briton Lewis Hamilton can win the Formula One World Championship.



 
Unscathed Kubica out of hospital
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica leaves hospital in Montreal after his horrific crash at the Canadian Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton hails 'historic' victory
Briton Lewis Hamilton says he is "on a different planet" after his maiden Formula One victory in Canada.








FORMULA ONE




Walker tips Hamilton for F1 title
Former commentator Murray Walker believes Briton Lewis Hamilton can win the Formula One World Championship.



 
Unscathed Kubica out of hospital
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica leaves hospital in Montreal after his horrific crash at the Canadian Grand Prix.



 
Hamilton hails 'historic' victory
Briton Lewis Hamilton says he is "on a different planet" after his maiden Formula One victory in Canada.








ATHLETICS




Gillick sets new Irish 400m mark
David Gillick smashes the Irish 400m record at Switzerland's Atletica Geneve meeting.



 
Devonish delivers relay warning
Marlon Devonish says Britain should avoid rushing its next batch of sprint talent into the senior international arena.



 
British duo claim wins in Turin
Tim Benjamin wins the 400m and Marlon Devonish the 100m at Friday's meeting in Turin.








CYCLING




Wiggins retains lead in Dauphine 
Britain's Bradley Wiggins retains a one-second overall lead after the first stage proper of the Dauphine Libere. 



 
Wiggins wins Dauphine time-trial
Britain's Bradley Wiggins gives his Tour de France prospects a boost by winning the prologue in the Dauphine Libere.



 
Tour takes Riis off winners list
Tour de France organisers say they no longer consider Bjarne Riis the 1996 race winner after his drugs confession.








FUN AND GAMES




Comment: Formula fun with Lewis
Robbo on Lewis Hamilton and the England cricket team



 
Ramprakash goes dancing again
Strictly Come Dancing star Mark Ramprakash breaks out a few of his best moves ahead of Surrey's Twenty20 campaign this summer.



 
Comment: Becks for good
Robbo on Beckham's return for England
